intro: Dorycnium kotschyanum, commonly known as the Kotschy's sainfoin, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils. It has a taproot system that allows it to survive in nutrient-poor conditions. Dorycnium kotschyanum is also known for its nitrogen-fixing ability, which makes it useful in ecological restoration projects.
